repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:
Current options for powershell and pwsh had mistakes and rationale behind them was not clear.

Solution:
Update the suggested options by splitting up powershell and pwsh, as well as ensuring that all options work and rationale is documented and discussed.

Closes #32921

comment_data.body: let's put this at the start so it's extra noticeable.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -5539,13 +5539,24 @@ A jump table for the options with a short description can be found at |Q_op|.
 	unescaping, so to keep yourself sane use |:let-&| like shown above.
 							*shell-powershell*
 	To use PowerShell: >vim
-		let &shell = executable('pwsh') ? 'pwsh' : 'powershell'
-		let &shellcmdflag = '-NoLogo -NonInteractive -ExecutionPolicy RemoteSigned -Command [Console]::InputEncoding=[Console]::OutputEncoding=[System.Text.UTF8Encoding]::new();$PSDefaultParameterValues[''Out-File:Encoding'']=''utf8'';$PSStyle.OutputRendering=''plaintext'';Remove-Alias -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue tee;'
-		let &shellredir = '2>&1 | %%{ "$_" } | Out-File %s; exit $LastExitCode'
-		let &shellpipe  = '2>&1 | %%{ "$_" } | tee %s; exit $LastExitCode'
+		let &shell = 'powershell'
+		let &shellcmdflag = '-NoLogo -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy RemoteSigned -Command '
+		let &shellcmdflag .= '[Console]::InputEncoding=[Console]::OutputEncoding=[System.Text.UTF8Encoding]::new();'
+		let &shellcmdflag .= '$PSDefaultParameterValues[''Out-File:Encoding'']=''utf8'';'
+		let &shellpipe  = '> %s 2>&1'
 		set shellquote= shellxquote=
+		set noshelltemp

comment_data.body: use the same indent as before
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -7660,15 +7659,26 @@ local options = {
         Note that such processing is done after |:set| did its own round of
         unescaping, so to keep yourself sane use |:let-&| like shown above.
         						*shell-powershell*
-        To use PowerShell: >vim
-        	let &shell = executable('pwsh') ? 'pwsh' : 'powershell'
-        	let &shellcmdflag = '-NoLogo -NonInteractive -ExecutionPolicy RemoteSigned -Command [Console]::InputEncoding=[Console]::OutputEncoding=[System.Text.UTF8Encoding]::new();$PSDefaultParameterValues[''Out-File:Encoding'']=''utf8'';$PSStyle.OutputRendering=''plaintext'';Remove-Alias -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue tee;'
-        	let &shellredir = '2>&1 | %%{ "$_" } | Out-File %s; exit $LastExitCode'
-        	let &shellpipe  = '2>&1 | %%{ "$_" } | tee %s; exit $LastExitCode'
-        	set shellquote= shellxquote=
-
-        <	This option cannot be set from a |modeline| or in the |sandbox|, for
-        security reasons.
+	To use PowerShell: >vim

@@ -7660,15 +7659,26 @@ local options = {
         Note that such processing is done after |:set| did its own round of
         unescaping, so to keep yourself sane use |:let-&| like shown above.
         						*shell-powershell*
-        To use PowerShell: >vim
-        	let &shell = executable('pwsh') ? 'pwsh' : 'powershell'
-        	let &shellcmdflag = '-NoLogo -NonInteractive -ExecutionPolicy RemoteSigned -Command [Console]::InputEncoding=[Console]::OutputEncoding=[System.Text.UTF8Encoding]::new();$PSDefaultParameterValues[''Out-File:Encoding'']=''utf8'';$PSStyle.OutputRendering=''plaintext'';Remove-Alias -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue tee;'
-        	let &shellredir = '2>&1 | %%{ "$_" } | Out-File %s; exit $LastExitCode'
-        	let &shellpipe  = '2>&1 | %%{ "$_" } | tee %s; exit $LastExitCode'
-        	set shellquote= shellxquote=
-
-        <	This option cannot be set from a |modeline| or in the |sandbox|, for
-        security reasons.
+	To use PowerShell: >vim
+		let &shell = 'powershell'
+		let &shellcmdflag = '-NoLogo -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy RemoteSigned -Command '
+		let &shellcmdflag .= '[Console]::InputEncoding=[Console]::OutputEncoding=[System.Text.UTF8Encoding]::new();'
+		let &shellcmdflag .= '$PSDefaultParameterValues[''Out-File:Encoding'']=''utf8'';'
+		let &shellpipe  = '> %s 2>&1'
+		set shellquote= shellxquote=
+		set noshelltemp

comment_regular_data.body:
I'm also aware that the pipeline failed here,
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/actions/runs/20064573013/job/57549667162?pr=36881#step:4:1976

Can someone offer any insight for how to do this through MSVC? I've tried using the dev shell it comes with and running `make doc` but it doesn't work...

For `make doc`, you need to make the changes in `options.lua`: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/71a22e20ad150fae7f42ca534e1b77208a51b83d/src/nvim/options.lua#L7662

The Makefile shows how to run the `doc` build task without `make`: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/ed9abb1851e31b98b79b1b06eef5ceeccdbb7372/Makefile#L150-L151

    cmake --build build --target doc

> For `make doc`, you need to make the changes in `options.lua`:
>  [...]
> ```
> cmake --build build --target doc
> ```

I tried to do this and the docs pipeline seem to have built successfully. Had to manually undo some stuff but hopefully I did it correctly. I also realised that I re-pushed with the issue number and after the changes were approved. I will re-push to fix the `lintcommit` error. Apologies if any of those mistakes are a problem...
Changed the indentation and moved `noshelltemp`. Hope that's what you meant.
Thanks for looking into this! The whitespace in options.lua is tricky, I pushed an update and made some minor tweaks.

No problem at all! Always happy to contribute even in small amounts to the amazing Neovim project. Indeed it was tricky to figure that stuff out and I really appreciate the help! I saw the commit you pushed and it contains much more than just my `options.lua` modifications, is that intentional?
Not sure what you mean. If you used github's "Compare" then it will show rebased changes unrelated to this PR.

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: docs(options): Update PowerShell and pwsh suggested options
